intro: Sterigmostemum elichrysifolium, commonly known as the golden leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Ficus species. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are usually yellow-green in color, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are berry-like and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. The botanical characteristics of S. elichrysifolium make it an interesting subject for studies on parasitic plant ecology and host-plant interactions.
